column2: What features are missing from your sources of information that you would like to see included?

column1: a lot of people are unaware of the extra $50 app fee(can be waved with Mass Health). They also don't realize that medical marijuana isn't taxed.
A more accurate understanding of the trace cannabinoids in the products available.
a wishlist/shopping list, and a way to save your favorite items
Accurate product testing, plant genetics/lineage/strain history
Actual rigorous medical research on benefits and harm of marijuana
Any of dr Sulak’s resources are amazing
Average cost between the dispensaries across the state, and tips on the best way/place to grow for myself
Better information about states other than CA, OR, WA, AZ, CO
Better inventory of what local dispensary has
better strain genetics, average testing % and deeper info
Breakdown Comparison of one strain to another
Cannabinoid ranges and regional availability/hardiness statistics
Cannabis lessons. Teach the public how to roll joints, dab, grow, maintain glass/pieces
Cannabis science: terpenes and cannabinoids for medicine
Comprehensiveness -- doesn't show everything they have
Consistency with scientific studies and analyses
Content related directly to my market and region
Cultivation methods, growing media, and fertilizers/pesticides used
Detailed information regarding concentrates available at dispensaries near me.
Details on how to identify strains
distinguishing physical features between strains and types ex indica vs sativa
Doctors', scientists', and cultivators' information regarding cannabis products, strains and how it is grown/manufactured
Dosage, testing information, safety details, loyalty, strain and product tracking/dosage logging.
Double blind studies and independent polls like this one.  Thanks!
Easier navigation of site on mobile
Easier to find sources to back up claims
Easily digestible (couple of sentences) the describe a products high or impact on you.
Effects of how other patients feels
Expert guidance, individual dosage advise & lab testing
Extensive discussion of the effects of each and every active ingredient; more information on the content of those "lesser" ingredients for each strain.
Fact based truth in the medical community
Features on how to obtain genetics
full online terpene and cannabinoid profiles for all strains available for purchase
Getting my congressmen/women to vote on reform
Grow info and curing method if these are done well the strain science should hold true, if not, quaility assurance is gone.
Growth stages and more indepth strain specific growing journals for all strains
home processing of flower to topicals
How exactly to use, as well as what to do if something unplanned for happens (like a coughing fit), for us neophytes!
How it affects with racng thoughts
How long the high will last
How to save the most money
I'd like to see the same thc and turpene readout that comes with purchased products on the apps.
I'd love to see a fuller chemical breakdown, more than just THC and CBD, but that's not even a big deal!
I'm satisfied with the amount of features present
I am a caregiver and in 98 I did 1 yr in jail n now want to get in the cannabis biz but would need help
I am happy with the sources info
I like peer reviewed scientific articles
I mainly check in with friends for information. No missing information
I usually just go to the dispensary website about current products available.
I would just like to have sources of information and to have cannabis be totally legal in the United States.
I would like to see a thirds party to select flower to send to testing.
I wouldn't know what else to look for
If edibles are available in a limited stock (i.e., the dispensary does not make their own edible products and must rely on another dispensary or distributor for products.
In stock strains fluctuate a lot, maybe a way to track
Incoming stains? Maybe something to look forward to.

ingredients in everything! including papers on pre-rolls, which can have corn and gluten in them. Severe food allergies. Also, list pesticide and chemicals used on the plants. The use of non organic practices must be transparent, and there is also a concern with allergies to these chemicals.
Lab test results for various producers
Leafly covers my needs very well
Legitimate pictures, the ones on Leafly are uploaded by anyone and could be any strain. Detailed description of effects
less emphasis on strain name and more emphasis and transparency re terpene profile
Let me buy direct from them
Local caregivers ancillary businesses social clubs community host agreements
Local grower information to keep up with new strains.
medical info and attributes, chemical breakdown of strain
More accurate lab results and higher TAC
More accurate search for strains, lifestyle stories, etc...
More advanced education for medical professionals
More ailments listed to pair with a strain.
More articles on small time growing for your windows
More comprehensive reviews, locations to obtain
More detail on terpenes, genomics, science
more detailed information on the effects of all the different strains
More direct brand patients education, facility tours and manufacturing processes, more education from testing labs
More explanation about the product. Web pages are very vague
More fear nformation on benefits of cannabis
more info on growing specific strains
More info on how different cannabinoids interact with one another.
More info on tinctures and edible use
more info on what the strain is good for (anxiety, depression, etc)
More information about how the ECS really works and how different strain profiles will interact with it.
More information on becoming more politically involved in the legalization process.
More information on supporting cannabinoids and terpenes. Most seem to focus on THC content, and according to a recent study THC (like opiates) only distracts you from pain.
More information on what works best for specific medical issues/diagnosis from survey of other patients

more lab reports and analysis of cannabinoid profiles in every strain, the reliability of strains from state-to-state, some standardization of cannabinoid profiles and effects for treating various conditions
More locally relevant information. Most don't update their menus often or prices.
More medical info. Like the basic fact that CBD can interact with other drugs and meds. And how chemo patients have got to check with someone they know knows!
More personal reviews and a legit dr help section with more factual medicinal based articles
More personal stories from patients about their experiences treating certain ailments with certain products
More specials listed menu  updates more frequently
More specifics of what products are testing at
More strain variety and more cannabinoid information.
more studies and scientific findings and information on medical use of marijuana
More up-to-date research on the enndocannabanoid system; more diesease/theraputic specific information (e.g., x, y, z strains are good at treating depression becuase of this specifc categoristic)

More workshops on site of dispensaries. Detailed in-depth information is often missing. I find a lot of articles that are dumbed down. That’s helpful when I was new but I’d like to learn more in-depth info that seems to lack.
N/a I don't read much on strain information
N/A, Just waiting for the government to catch up.
None - again, this question shouldn't be required. I don't have a bud tender or whatever either. I really don't dig into it that much.
None really; Leafly reviews are pretty thorough
